p: A Gen24-generated minimisation program that incorporates a random element will be used to ensure treatment groups are well balanced for specific participant characteristics. For R1 these are: β 2-microglobulin concentration at first relapse (< 3.5, 3.5–< 5.5, ≥ 5.5 mg/L, unknown); length of first remission or plateau (< 18 months, 18–24 months or > 24 months); response to ITD re-induction therapy (< VGPR or ≥ VGPR); cytogenetic risk status at trial entry (Standard Risk, High-Risk or Unknown), as defined by Palumbo et al., in the presence of del(17p) and/or translocation t(4;14), and/or translocation t(14;16) [ 25] and maintenance treatment received in first-line setting (Yes or No).
